title: Which of the following is an invalid if-else statement?
The “else if” in conditional inclusion is written by?
In a conditional inclusion, if the condition that comes after the if is true, then what will happen during compilation?
answer_1: Then the code up to the following #else or #elif or #endif is compiled
answer_2: Then the code up to the following #endif is compiled even if #else or #elif is present
answer_3: Then the code up to the following #eliif is compiled
right_answer: Then the code up to the following #else or #elif or #endif is compiled

title: Conditional inclusion can be used for ___________
answer_1: Preventing multiple declarations of a variable
answer_2: Check for existence of a variable and doing something if it exists
answer_3: Preventing multiple declarations of same function

title: For each #if, #ifdef, and #ifndef directive.
answer_1: There are zero or more #elif directives

title: The #else directive is used for _________
answer_1: Conditionally include source text if the previous #if, #ifdef, #ifndef, or #elif test fails
answer_2: Conditionally include source text if a macro name is not defined
answer_3: Conditionally include source text if a macro name is defined
right_answer: Conditionally include source text if the previous #if, #ifdef, #ifndef, or #elif test fails
